00001 /* File amber_prmtop_structs.h begun on 20080424 by BLFoley
00002         Purpose: structure for amber prmtop file info */
00003 
00004 // If you add new flags, also add formats, preserving order -AND- define the
00005 //      new flag in the amber_prmtop structure below and in the initialization
00006 //      function (currently amber_prmtop_init.c).
00007 //      NOTE: one space to separate fields, no space at end of set!
00008 #define AMBER_PRMTOP_FLAGS "TITLE POINTERS ATOM_NAME CHARGE MASS \
00009 ATOM_TYPE_INDEX NUMBER_EXCLUDED_ATOMS NONBONDED_PARM_INDEX RESIDUE_LABEL RESIDUE_ID \
00010 RESIDUE_POINTER BOND_FORCE_CONSTANT BOND_EQUIL_VALUE ANGLE_FORCE_CONSTANT ANGLE_EQUIL_VALUE \
00011 DIHEDRAL_FORCE_CONSTANT DIHEDRAL_PERIODICITY DIHEDRAL_PHASE SOLTY LENNARD_JONES_ACOEF \
00012 LENNARD_JONES_BCOEF BONDS_INC_HYDROGEN BONDS_WITHOUT_HYDROGEN ANGLES_INC_HYDROGEN ANGLES_WITHOUT_HYDROGEN \
00013 DIHEDRALS_INC_HYDROGEN DIHEDRALS_WITHOUT_HYDROGEN EXCLUDED_ATOMS_LIST HBOND_ACOEF HBOND_BCOEF \
00014 HBCUT AMBER_ATOM_TYPE TREE_CHAIN_CLASSIFICATION JOIN_ARRAY IROTAT \
00015 SOLVENT_POINTERS ATOMS_PER_MOLECULE BOX_DIMENSIONS CAP_INFO CAP_INFO2 \
00016 RADIUS_SET RADII SCREEN LES_NTYP LES_TYPE \
00017 LES_FAC LES_CNUM LES_ID PERT_BOND_ATOMS PERT_BOND_PARAMS \
00018 PERT_ANGLE_ATOMS PERT_ANGLE_PARAMS PERT_DIHEDRAL_ATOMS PERT_DIHEDRAL_PARAMS PERT_RESIDUE_NAME \
00019 PERT_ATOM_NAME PERT_ATOM_SYMBOL ALMPER IAPER PERT_ATOM_TYPE_INDEX \
00020 PERT_CHARGE POLARIZABILITY PERT_POLARIZABILITY"
00021 #define AMBER_PRMTOP_FORMATS "20a4 10I8 20a4 5E16.8 5E16.8 \
00022 10I8 10I8 10I8 20a4 10a8 \
00023 10I8 5E16.8 5E16.8 5E16.8 5E16.8 \
00024 5E16.8 5E16.8 5E16.8 5E16.8 5E16.8 \
00025 5E16.8 10I8 10I8 10I8 10I8 \
00026 10I8 10I8 10I8 5E16.8 5E16.8 \
00027 5E16.8 20a4 20a4 10I8 10I8 \
00028 3I8 10I8 5E16.8 10I8 5E16.8 \
00029 1a80 5E16.8 5E16.8 10I8 10I8 \
00030 5E16 10I8 10I8 10I8 10I8 \
00031 10I8 10I8 10I8 10I8 20a4 \
00032 20a4 20a4 5E16.8 10I8 10I8 \
00033 5E16.8 5E16.8 5E16.8"

00035 // structure representing a section in a topology file
00036 typedef struct {
00037         char *N; // the "FLAG" name of this section
00038         char *FORMAT; // the formatting information, as found in the file
00039         char *TYPE; // the type of data contained in this section, e.g., char, int, double (no float...)
00040         char *desc; // description of data in this section (free format)
00041         int is_standard; // =0 if a standard section, not =0 if not standard
00042         int nc; // number of characters per datum
00043         int npl; // data points per line
00044         int nt; // total number of pieces of data
00045         int ns; // number of datum points per set (e.g., =3 for x,y,z data)
00046         int nu; // number of units of information (=nt/ns) (one of these will get deleted... maybe)
00047         char **D; // pointer to nt bits of data (will read in the prmtop file as-is and convert later)
00048 } amber_prmtop_section;
00049 
00050 // structure amber_prmtop
00051 //
00052 // IMPORTANT NOTES 
00053 // After the first few entries about filenames and headers, all the entries,
00054 //      despite being named for AMBER prmtop variables, are NOT the actual
00055 //      variables.  Rather, they are pointers to positions in the section
00056 //      structures.
00057 // Programmers wishing to alter/update this should also consider the contents
00058 //      of the initialization function (currently amber_prmtop_init.c) to 
00059 //      learn the data types used in the sections.
00060 typedef struct {
00061         char *FN; // name of file from which the data were obtained
00062         char *VERSION; // the top line that usually discusses version info
00063         int nS; // number of sections found
00064         char **SN; // names of sections, in the order found
00065         amber_prmtop_section *S; // addresses for the actual sections
00066         int nSS; // number of standard sections found
00067         int *SS; // pointers to those standard sections
00068         int nES;// number of extra sections found
00069         int *ES; // list of ES addresses
00070         int nFF,*FORMATS; // for programming later
00071         char **FLAGS; // list of known flags
00072 //FORMAT(20a4)  (ITITL(i), i=1,20)
00073         int ITITL; // the title section
00074 // Read the "pointers" section in here, as well as into an 
00075 //      amber_prmtop_section, but save room for extras if found
00076         int POINTERS; // pointer to the section containing the original char-strings
00077 //FORMAT(12i6) 
00078         int NATOM  ; // total number of atoms 
00079         int NTYPES ; // total number of distinct atom types
00080         int NBONH  ; // number of bonds containing hydrogen
00081         int MBONA  ; // number of bonds not containing hydrogen
00082         int NTHETH ; // number of angles containing hydrogen
00083         int MTHETA ; // number of angles not containing hydrogen
00084         int NPHIH  ; // number of dihedrals containing hydrogen
00085         int MPHIA  ; // number of dihedrals not containing hydrogen
00086         int NHPARM ; // currently not used
00087         int NPARM  ; // currently not used
00088         int NEXT   ; // number of excluded atoms
00089         int NRES   ; // number of residues
00090         int NBONA  ; // MBONA + number of constraint bonds
00091         int NTHETA ; // MTHETA + number of constraint angles
00092         int NPHIA  ; // MPHIA + number of constraint dihedrals
00093         int NUMBND ; // number of unique bond types
00094         int NUMANG ; // number of unique angle types
00095         int NPTRA  ; // number of unique dihedral types
00096         int NATYP  ; // number of atom types in parameter file, see SOLTY below
00097         int NPHB   ; // number of distinct 10-12 hydrogen bond pair types
00098         int IFPERT ; // set to 1 if perturbation info is to be read in
00099         int NBPER  ; // number of bonds to be perturbed
00100         int NGPER  ; // number of angles to be perturbed
00101         int NDPER  ; // number of dihedrals to be perturbed
00102         int MBPER  ; // number of bonds with atoms completely in perturbed group
00103         int MGPER  ; // number of angles with atoms completely in perturbed group
00104         int MDPER  ; // number of dihedrals with atoms completely in perturbed groups
00105         int IFBOX  ; // set to 1 if standard periodic box, 2 when truncated octahedral
00106         int NMXRS  ; // number of atoms in the largest residue
00107         int IFCAP  ; // set to 1 if the CAP option from edit was specified
00108 // FORMAT(20a4)  (IGRAPH(i), i=1,NATOM)
00109         int IGRAPH; // IGRAPH : the user atoms names 
00110 // FORMAT(5E16.8)  (CHRG(i), i=1,NATOM)
00111         int CHRG   ; // CHRG   : the atom charges.  
00112                 // (Divide by 18.2223 to convert to charge in units of the electron charge) 
00113 // FORMAT(5E16.8)  (AMASS(i), i=1,NATOM)
00114         int AMASS  ; // AMASS  : the atom masses 
00115 // FORMAT(12I6)  (IAC(i), i=1,NATOM)
00116         int IAC    ; // IAC    : index for the atom types involved in Lennard Jones (6-12) 
00117                 // interactions.  See ICO below.  
00118 // FORMAT(12I6)  (NUMEX(i), i=1,NATOM)
00119         int NUMEX  ; // NUMEX  : total number of excluded atoms for atom "i".  See
00120                 // NATEX below.  
00121 // FORMAT(12I6)  (ICO(i), i=1,NTYPES*NTYPES)
00122         int ICO    ; // ICO    : provides the index to the nonbon parameter
00123                 // arrays CN1, CN2 and ASOL, BSOL.  All possible 6-12
00124                 // or 10-12 atoms type interactions are represented.
00125                 // NOTE: A particular atom type can have either a 10-12
00126                 // or a 6-12 interaction, but not both.  The index is
00127                 // calculated as follows:
00128                 // index = ICO(NTYPES*(IAC(i)-1)+IAC(j))
00129                 // If index is positive, this is an index into the
00130                 // 6-12 parameter arrays (CN1 and CN2) otherwise it
00131                 // is an index into the 10-12 parameter arrays (ASOL and BSOL).  
00132 // FORMAT(20A4)  (LABRES(i), i=1,NRES)
00133         int LABRES ; // LABRES : the residue labels 
00134 // ****** START HERE -- figure out the actual AMBER name for this...
00135 // ------ LOOK vvvvvvvv
00136         int IRES;  // the residue numbers (of some sort)
00137 // ------ LOOK ^^^^^^^^
00138 // *****
00139 // FORMAT(12I6)  (IPRES(i), i=1,NRES)
00140         int IPRES  ; // IPRES  : atoms in each residue are listed for atom "i" in
00141                 // IPRES(i) to IPRES(i+1)-1 
00142 // FORMAT(5E16.8)  (RK(i), i=1,NUMBND)
00143         int RK     ; // RK     : force constant for the bonds of each type, kcal/mol 
00144 // FORMAT(5E16.8)  (REQ(i), i=1,NUMBND)
00145         int REQ    ; // REQ    : the equilibrium bond length for the bonds of each type, angstroms 
00146 // FORMAT(5E16.8)  (TK(i), i=1,NUMANG)
00147         int TK     ; // TK     : force constant for the angles of each type, kcal/mol A**2 
00148 // FORMAT(5E16.8)  (TEQ(i), i=1,NUMANG)
00149         int TEQ    ; // TEQ    : the equilibrium angle for the angles of each type, radians 
00150 // FORMAT(5E16.8)  (PK(i), i=1,NPTRA)
00151         int PK     ; // PK     : force constant for the dihedrals of each type, kcal/mol 
00152 // FORMAT(5E16.8)  (PN(i), i=1,NPTRA)
00153         int PN     ; // PN     : periodicity of the dihedral of a given type 
00154 // FORMAT(5E16.8)  (PHASE(i), i=1,NPTRA)
00155         int PHASE  ; // PHASE  : phase of the dihedral of a given type, radians 
00156 // FORMAT(5E16.8)  (SOLTY(i), i=1,NATYP)
00157         int SOLTY  ; // SOLTY  : currently unused (reserved for future use) 
00158 // FORMAT(5E16.8)  (CN1(i), i=1,NTYPES*(NTYPES+1)/2)
00159         int CN1    ; // CN1    : Lennard Jones r**12 terms for all possible atom type
00160                 // interactions, indexed by ICO and IAC; for atom i and j
00161                 // where i < j, the index into this array is as follows
00162                 // (assuming the value of ICO(index) is positive):
00163                 // CN1(ICO(NTYPES*(IAC(i)-1)+IAC(j))).  
00164 // FORMAT(5E16.8)  (CN2(i), i=1,NTYPES*(NTYPES+1)/2)
00165         int CN2    ; // CN2    : Lennard Jones r**6 terms for all possible atom type
00166                 // interactions.  Indexed like CN1 above.  
00167 /* NOTE: the atom numbers in the following arrays that describe bonds, 
00168         angles, and dihedrals are coordinate array indexes for runtime speed. 
00169         The true atom number equals the absolute value of the number divided by 
00170         three, plus one. In the case of the dihedrals, if the fourth atom is negative, 
00171         this implies that the dihedral is an improper. If the third atom is negative, 
00172         this implies that the end group interations are to be ignored. End group 
00173         interactions are ignored, for example, in dihedrals of various ring systems 
00174         (to prevent int counting of 1-4 interactions) and in multiterm dihedrals.  */
00175 // FORMAT(12I6)  (IBH(i),JBH(i),ICBH(i), i=1,NBONH)
00176         int IBH    ; // IBH    : atom involved in bond "i", bond contains hydrogen
00177         int JBH    ; // JBH    : atom involved in bond "i", bond contains hydrogen
00178         int ICBH   ; // ICBH   : index into parameter arrays RK and REQ 
00179 // FORMAT(12I6)  (IB(i),JB(i),ICB(i), i=1,NBONA)
00180         int IB     ; // IB     : atom involved in bond "i", bond does not contain hydrogen
00181         int JB     ; // JB     : atom involved in bond "i", bond does not contain hydrogen
00182         int ICB    ; // ICB    : index into parameter arrays RK and REQ 
00183 // FORMAT(12I6)  (ITH(i),JTH(i),KTH(i),ICTH(i), i=1,NTHETH)
00184         int ITH    ; // ITH    : atom involved in angle "i", angle contains hydrogen
00185         int JTH    ; // JTH    : atom involved in angle "i", angle contains hydrogen
00186         int KTH    ; // KTH    : atom involved in angle "i", angle contains hydrogen
00187         int ICTH   ; // ICTH   : index into parameter arrays TK and TEQ for angle
00188                 // ITH(i)-JTH(i)-KTH(i) 
00189 // FORMAT(12I6)  (IT(i),JT(i),KT(i),ICT(i), i=1,NTHETA)
00190         int IT     ; // IT     : atom involved in angle "i", angle does not contain hydrogen
00191         int JT     ; // JT     : atom involved in angle "i", angle does not contain hydrogen
00192         int KT     ; // KT     : atom involved in angle "i", angle does not contain hydrogen
00193         int ICT    ; // ICT    : index into parameter arrays TK and TEQ for angle
00194                 // IT(i)-JT(i)-KT(i) 
00195 // FORMAT(12I6)  (IPH(i),JPH(i),KPH(i),LPH(i),ICPH(i), i=1,NPHIH)
00196         int IPH    ; // IPH    : atom involved in dihedral "i", dihedral contains hydrogen
00197         int JPH    ; // JPH    : atom involved in dihedral "i", dihedral contains hydrogen
00198         int KPH    ; // KPH    : atom involved in dihedral "i", dihedral contains hydrogen
00199         int LPH    ; // LPH    : atom involved in dihedral "i", dihedral contains hydrogen
00200         int ICPH   ; // ICPH   : index into parameter arrays PK, PN, and PHASE for
00201                 // dihedral IPH(i)-JPH(i)-KPH(i)-LPH(i)
00202 
00203 // FORMAT(12I6)  (IP(i),JP(i),KP(i),LP(i),ICP(i), i=1,NPHIA)
00204         int IP     ; // IP     : atom involved in dihedral "i", dihedral does not contain hydrogen
00205         int JP     ; // JP     : atom involved in dihedral "i", dihedral does not contain hydrogen
00206         int KP     ; // KP     : atom involved in dihedral "i", dihedral does not contain hydrogen
00207         int LP     ; // LP     : atom involved in dihedral "i", dihedral does not contain hydrogen
00208         int ICP    ; // ICP    : index into parameter arrays PK, PN, and PHASE for
00209                 // dihedral IPH(i)-JPH(i)-KPH(i)-LPH(i).  Note, if the
00210                 // periodicity is negative, this implies the following entry
00211                 // in the PK, PN, and PHASE arrays is another term in a
00212                 // multitermed dihedral.  
00213 // FORMAT(12I6)  (NATEX(i), i=1,NEXT)
00214         int NATEX  ; // NATEX  : the excluded atom list.  To get the excluded list for atom 
00215                 // "i" you need to traverse the NUMEX list, adding up all
00216                 // the previous NUMEX values, since NUMEX(i) holds the number
00217                 // of excluded atoms for atom "i", not the index into the 
00218                 // NATEX list.  Let IEXCL = SUM(NUMEX(j), j=1,i-1), then
00219                 // excluded atoms are NATEX(IEXCL) to NATEX(IEXCL+NUMEX(i)).  
00220 // FORMAT(5E16.8)  (ASOL(i), i=1,NPHB)
00221         int ASOL   ; // ASOL   : the value for the r**12 term for hydrogen bonds of all
00222                 // possible types.  Index into these arrays is equivalent
00223                 // to the CN1 and CN2 arrays, however the index is negative.
00224                 // For example, for atoms i and j, with i < j, the index is
00225                 // -ICO(NTYPES*(IAC(i)-1+IAC(j)).  
00226 // FORMAT(5E16.8)  (BSOL(i), i=1,NPHB)
00227         int BSOL   ; // BSOL   : the value for the r**10 term for hydrogen bonds of all
00228                 // possible types.  Indexed like ASOL.  
00229 // FORMAT(5E16.8)  (HBCUT(i), i=1,NPHB)
00230         int HBCUT  ; // HBCUT  : no longer in use 
00231 // FORMAT(20A4)  (ISYMBL(i), i=1,NATOM)
00232         int ISYMBL ; // ISYMBL : the AMBER atom types for each atom 
00233 // FORMAT(20A4)  (ITREE(i), i=1,NATOM)
00234         int ITREE  ; // ITREE  : the list of tree joining information, classified into five
00235                 // types.  M -- main chain, S -- side chain, B -- branch point, 
00236                 // 3 -- branch into three chains, E -- end of the chain 
00237 // FORMAT(12I6)  (JOIN(i), i=1,NATOM)
00238         int JOIN   ; // JOIN   : tree joining information, potentially used in ancient
00239                 // analysis programs.  Currently unused in sander or gibbs.  
00240 // FORMAT(12I6)  (IROTAT(i), i = 1, NATOM)
00241         int IROTAT ; // IROTAT : apparently the last atom that would move if atom i was
00242                 // rotated, however the meaning has been lost over time.
00243                 // Currently unused in sander or gibbs.
00244 // The following are only present if IFBOX .gt. 0 
00245 // FORMAT(12I6)  IPTRES, NSPM, NSPSOL
00246         int IPTRES ; // IPTRES : final residue that is considered part of the solute,
00247                 // reset in sander and gibbs
00248         int NSPM   ; // NSPM   : total number of molecules
00249         int NSPSOL ; // NSPSOL : the first solvent "molecule" 
00250 // FORMAT(12I6)  (NSP(i), i=1,NSPM)
00251         int NSP    ; // NSP    : the total number of atoms in each molecule,
00252                 // necessary to correctly perform the pressure scaling.  
00253 // FORMAT(5E16.8)  BETA, BOX(1), BOX(2), BOX(3)
00254         int BETA   ; // BETA   : periodic box, angle between the XY and YZ planes in degrees.
00255         int BOX    ; // BOX    : the periodic box lengths in the X, Y, and Z directions 
00256 // The following are only present if IFCAP .gt. 0 
00257 // FORMAT(12I6)  NATCAP
00258         int NATCAP ; // NATCAP : last atom before the start of the cap of waters placed by edit 
00259 // FORMAT(5E16.8)  CUTCAP, XCAP, YCAP, ZCAP
00260         int CUTCAP ; // CUTCAP : the distance from the center of the cap to the outside
00261         int XCAP   ; // XCAP   : X coordinate for the center of the cap
00262         int YCAP   ; // YCAP   : Y coordinate for the center of the cap
00263         int ZCAP   ; // ZCAP   : Z coordinate for the center of the cap 
00264 // The following is only present if IFPERT .gt. 0
00265 /* Note that the initial state, or equivalently the prep/link/edit state, 
00266         is represented by lambda=1 and the perturbed state, or final state 
00267         specified in parm, is the lambda=0 state. */ 
00268 // FORMAT(12I6)  (IBPER(i), JBPER(i), i=1,NBPER)
00269         int IBPER  ; // IBPER  : atoms involved in perturbed bonds
00270         int JBPER  ; // JBPER  : atoms involved in perturbed bonds 
00271 // FORMAT(12I6)  (ICBPER(i), i=1,2*NBPER)
00272         int ICBPER ; // ICBPER : pointer into the bond parameter arrays RK and REQ for the
00273                 // perturbed bonds.  ICBPER(i) represents lambda=1 and 
00274                 // ICBPER(i+NBPER) represents lambda=0.  
00275 // FORMAT(12I6)  (ITPER(i), JTPER(i), KTPER(i), i=1,NGPER)
00276         int IPTER  ; // IPTER  : atoms involved in perturbed angles
00277         int JTPER  ; // JTPER  : atoms involved in perturbed angles
00278         int KTPER  ; // KTPER  : atoms involved in perturbed angles 
00279 // FORMAT(12I6)  (ICTPER(i), i=1,2*NGPER)
00280         int ICTPER ; // ICTPER : pointer into the angle parameter arrays TK and TEQ for 
00281                 // the perturbed angles.  ICTPER(i) represents lambda=0 and 
00282                 // ICTPER(i+NGPER) represents lambda=1.  
00283 // FORMAT(12I6)  (IPPER(i), JPPER(i), KPPER(i), LPPER(i), i=1,NDPER)
00284         int IPPER  ; // IPPER  : atoms involved in perturbed dihedrals
00285         int JPPER  ; // JPPER  : atoms involved in perturbed dihedrals
00286         int KPPER  ; // KPPER  : atoms involved in perturbed dihedrals
00287         int LPPER  ; // LPPER  : atoms involved in pertrubed dihedrals 
00288 // FORMAT(12I6)  (ICPPER(i), i=1,2*NDPER)
00289         int ICPPER ; // ICPPER : pointer into the dihedral parameter arrays PK, PN and
00290                 // PHASE for the perturbed dihedrals.  ICPPER(i) represents 
00291                 // lambda=1 and ICPPER(i+NGPER) represents lambda=0.  
00292 // FORMAT(20A4)  (LABRES(i), i=1,NRES)
00293         int LRESPER ; // LABRES : residue names at lambda=0 
00294 // FORMAT(20A4)  (IGRPER(i), i=1,NATOM)
00295         int IGRPER ; // IGRPER : atomic names at lambda=0 
00296 // FORMAT(20A4)  (ISMPER(i), i=1,NATOM)
00297         int ISMPER ; // ISMPER : atomic symbols at lambda=0 
00298 // FORMAT(5E16.8)  (ALMPER(i), i=1,NATOM)
00299         int ALMPER ; // ALMPER : unused currently in gibbs 
00300 // FORMAT(12I6)  (IAPER(i), i=1,NATOM)
00301         int IAPER  ; // IAPER  : IAPER(i) = 1 if the atom is being perturbed 
00302 // FORMAT(12I6)  (IACPER(i), i=1,NATOM)
00303         int IACPER ; // IACPER : index for the atom types involved in Lennard Jones
00304                 // interactions at lambda=0.  Similar to IAC above.  See ICO above.  
00305 // FORMAT(5E16.8)  (CGPER(i), i=1,NATOM)
00306         int CGPER  ; // CGPER  : atomic charges at lambda=0 
00307 // The following is only present if IPOL .eq. 1 
00308 // FORMAT(5E18.8) (ATPOL(i), i=1,NATOM)
00309         int ATPOL  ; // ATPOL  : atomic polarizabilities 
00310 // The following is only present if IPOL .eq. 1 .and. IFPERT .eq. 1 
00311 // FORMAT(5E18.8) (ATPOL1(i), i=1,NATOM)
00312         int ATPOL1 ; // ATPOL1 : atomic polarizabilities at lambda = 1 (above is at lambda = 0) 
00313 } amber_prmtop;
